articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: President Donald Trump's foreign aid pause has forced a suspension of flights for more than 40,000 Afghans approved for special U.S. visas and at risk of Taliban retribution, a leading advocate and a U.S. official said on Saturday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Flights halted for Afghans approved for special US visas, advocate and official say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian militant movement Hamas is expected to release four female Israeli soldiers on Saturday in exchange for a group of Palestinian prisoners under a ceasefire agreement aimed at ending the 15-month-old war in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas set to release four Israeli soldier hostages in second swap

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Diego Oré
articles.description: Mexico has refused a request from President Donald Trump's administration to allow a U.S. military aircraft deporting migrants to land in the country, a U.S. official and a Mexican official told Reuters.
articles.title: Mexico refuses U.S. military flight deporting migrants, sources say

articles.author: Erin Banco
articles.description: The Central Intelligence Agency has assessed that the COVID-19 pandemic is "more likely" to have emerged from a lab rather than from nature, an agency spokesperson said on Saturday.
articles.title: CIA now says COVID-19 'more likely' to have come from lab

articles.author: Andrew Hay
articles.description: Twenty-eight-year old Ambrose Begay died after a fentanyl overdose under a tree 125 yards from his home on the Alamo Navajo reservation in southern New Mexico two years ago.
articles.title: U.S. fentanyl deaths are down. But not on this New Mexico reservation

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: In office for only five days, Trump has already imposed his will on Washington with ruthless speed and efficiency.
articles.title: Trump, at zenith of power, moves quickly to 'take over' Washington

articles.author: Emma-Victoria Farr
articles.description: Elon Musk made a surprise appearance during Germany's AfD (Alternative fuer Deutschland) election campaign event in Halle in eastern Germany on Saturday, speaking publicly in support of the far right party for the second time in as many weeks.
articles.title: Elon Musk appears on video at German far right campaign event

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hegseth was confirmed after a 50-50 vote in the Senate, when Vice President JD Vance came to the chamber to break the tie.
articles.title: Hegseth narrowly wins confirmation to become US defense secretary

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The U.S. State Department issued a "stop-work" order on Friday for all existing foreign assistance and paused new aid, according to a memo seen by Reuters, fulfilling an order issued by President Donald Trump.
articles.title: US stops work on foreign aid after Trump orders review

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The U.S. government said on Saturday it was "critical" that implementation of the Gaza ceasefire continues, after four Israeli soldiers were freed by Palestinian Hamas militants in exchange for 200 Palestinian prisoners.
articles.title: US says it is 'critical' that Gaza ceasefire implementation continues
